byline.contributor: Spencer Parts and Logan Sander contributed reporting.

abstract: Pres Woodrow Wilson, who was president of Princeton University in early 20th century and is deeply linked to school's identity, has come under attack there for his racist views; student group called Black Justice League has been drawing attention to Wilson's racist legacy through protests demanding school recognize it and rename institutions currently named for him, sparking campus-wide controversy.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to remove Mr. Wilson’s name from a residential complex and the public policy school at Princeton University have raised difficult questions about a prominent graduate’s racist legacy.

headline.main: At Princeton, Woodrow Wilson, a Heralded Alum, Is Recast as an Intolerant One
headline.print_headline: At Princeton, Woodrow Wilson, a Heralded Alum, Is Recast as an Intolerant One

snippet: Efforts to remove Mr. Wilson’s name from a residential complex and the public policy school at Princeton University have raised difficult questions about a prominent graduate’s racist legacy.
